pull.title: wallet: fix unrelated parent conflict doesn't cause child tx to be marked as conflict
pull.body:
This PR implements a fix for the issue described in https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/issues/29435.

The problem is that the wallet is unable to abandon transactions that have unrelated parent conflicts. The solution implemented here, augments the mempool transaction `REPLACED` signal with the double-spending transaction which the wallet stores and watches for in Block notifications. A map is added to the wallet to track conflicting tx ids and their child transactions.  The entry is erased when the double-spending tx is removed from MemPool.

issue.title: wallet: track mempool conflicts with wallet transactions
issue.body:
The `mempool_conflicts` variable is added to `CWalletTx`, it is a set of txids of txs in the mempool conflicting with the wallet tx or a wallet tx's parent. This PR only changes how mempool-conflicted txs are dealt with in memory.

`IsSpent` now returns false for an output being spent by a mempool conflicted transaction where it previously returned true.

A txid is added to `mempool_conflicts` during  `transactionAddedToMempool`. A txid is removed from `mempool_conflicts` during  `transactionRemovedFromMempool`.

This PR also adds a `mempoolconflicts` field to the `gettransaction` wallet RPC result.

Builds on #27145
Second attempt at #18600

events.message:
Change MemPoolRemovalReason to variant type

This allows the mempool to send additional data with TransactionRemovedFromMempool event.
Now, we can send the txid of the tx causing the replacement of another tx with the event.

Handle double-spending of unrelated parents to wallet txs

Detect replacement of wallet txs and capture the double-spend tx then wait for confirmation of double-spend tx before marking wallet tx as conflicted
test: Conflict with unconfirmed parent not in wallet

events.body: Draft until I've gotten some more feedback on the approach.

issue.title: Cluster size 2 package rbf
issue.body:
Allows any 2 transaction package with no in-mempool ancestors to do package RBF when directly conflicting with other mempool clusters of size two or less.


Proposed validation steps:
1) If the transaction package is of size 1, legacy rbf rules apply.
2) Otherwise the transaction package consists of a (parent, child) pair with no other in-mempool ancestors (or descendants, obviously), so it is also going to create a cluster of size 2). If larger, fail.
3) The package rbf may not evict more than 100 transactions from the mempool(bip125 rule 5)
4) The package's child tx has greater feerate than the parent tx (otherwise the parent should have RBF'd on its own at step 0)
5) Every directly conflicted mempool transaction is connected to at most 1 other in-mempool transaction (ie the cluster size of the conflict is at most 2).
6) Diagram check: We ensure that the replacement is strictly superior at all points, improving the mempool (which includes bip125 rule 3)
7) The total fee of the package, minus the total fee of what is being evicted, is at least the minrelayfee * size of the package (equivalent to bip125 rule 3 and 4)

Post-cluster mempool this will likely be expanded to general package rbf, but this is what we can safely support today.
